page.title: 09FARMING IN PRESTON CAPES
page.content: The pattern of farming to the south of the village has changed over the last ten years. Hedges have disappeared to accommodate large scale arable farming. Increased mechanisation combined with this has redically reduced the number of people dependent on the land for their livelihood. The area if predominantly arable. The majority of the land being part of a larger unit. The large machinery now used causes problems on the narrow country lanes. There are seven working farms. Two are arable. One fattens beef cattle. The rest mix arable and livestock farming in a more traditional way. Only one of these has a dairy herd. Another trains race horses alongside farming activities.
